required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Standing Cognition and Co-morbidities of POTS Evaluation
clinical_study.official_title: Standing Cognition and Co-morbidities of POTS Evaluation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate cognition in patients with postural tachycardia syndrome (POTS) while lying down and standing and to assess the prevalence of hypermobile Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome in POTS.

primary_outcome.description: Testing scores are normalized using T-scores for predicted values based on age and education for each participant. Scores range from 0 to 100. Higher numbers indicate better cognition. Testing will be performed while participants are supine and standing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Attention Score Using Cogstate Identification Task
secondary_outcome.description: Scores are measured as speed to complete task with lower numbers indicating faster reaction time. Testing will be performed while participants are supine and standing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Hypermobile Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (hEDS)
secondary_outcome.description: hEDS was evaluated using the Diagnostic Criteria for hEDS checklist. The number of participants who fulfill the diagnostic criteria on the checklist are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart Rate Standing Minus Heart Rate Supine
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate (HR) will be measured using an arm blood pressure cuff while participants are in supine and standing postures. The difference in heart rate (HR standing - HR supine) was calculated for each participant.

arm_group.description: Participants will complete cognitive testing while standing.
Participants will complete cognitive testing while supine.

intervention.description: Participants will stand and complete cognitive tests.
Participants will complete cognitive tests while supine.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Previously diagnosed with POTS, or healthy control
- Age between 13-60 years
- Participants may be any race, ethnicity, sex, or gender
- Able and willing to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to give, or withdrawal of, informed consent
- Age ≤ 13 or ≥ 61 years
- Prisoners
- Unable to stand

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 100 participants with POTS were recruited at the 2018 Dysautonomia International Conference in June 2018 in Nashville, TN. 39 Healthy participants were enrolled at Penn State Hershey Medical Center from August 2018- December 2019,
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants with odd study IDs completed cognitive testing while supine first. Participants with even study IDs completed cognitive testing standing first.

group.title: POTS- Supine First, Then Standing
group.description: Volunteers previously diagnosed with postural tachycardia syndrome, able to stand unassisted, age 13-60 years. Odd numbered participants assigned to complete cognitive tests in the supine posture first then in the standing posture.

group.title: POTS- Standing First, Then Supine
group.description: Volunteers previously diagnosed with postural tachycardia syndrome, able to stand unassisted, age 13-60 years. Even numbered participants assigned to complete cognitive tests in the standing posture first, then supine.

group.title: Controls- Supine First, Then Standing
group.description: Healthy volunteers with no chronic or systemic illness, age 13-60 years. Odd numbered participants assigned to complete cognitive tests in the supine posture first then in the standing posture.

group.title: Controls- Standing First, Then Supine
group.description: Healthy volunteers with no chronic or systemic illness, age 13-60 years. Even numbered participants assigned to complete cognitive tests in the standing posture first, then supine.

group.title: POTS
group.description: Participants previously diagnosed with postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome who were able to stand unassisted were enrolled

group.title: Control
group.description: Healthy volunteers that were free of chronic illness were enrolled

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Executive Function (Stroop Word-color Test)
outcome.description: Testing scores are normalized using T-scores for predicted values based on age and education for each participant. Scores range from 0 to 100. Higher numbers indicate better cognition. Testing will be performed while participants are supine and standing.
outcome.population: 13 participants dropped out (by their choice) prior to study visit. Mean and standard deviation scores for each arm are reported.

group.title: POTS- Supine, Standing
group.description: Participants previously diagnosed with postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome who were able to stand unassisted. Odd numbered participants were assigned to cognitive testing in the supine posture first, then in the standing posture.

group.title: POTS- Standing, Supine
group.description: Participants previously diagnosed with postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome who were able to stand unassisted. Even numbered participants were assigned to cognitive testing in the standing posture first, then in the supine posture.

group.title: Control- Supine, Standing
group.description: Healthy volunteers that were free of chronic illness. Odd numbered participants were assigned to cognitive testing in the supine posture first, then in the standing posture.

group.title: Control- Standing, Supine
group.description: Healthy volunteers, free of chronic illness. Even numbered participants were assigned to cognitive testing in the standing posture first, then in the supine posture.

measure.title: Executive Function (Stroop Word-color Test)
measure.description: Testing scores are normalized using T-scores for predicted values based on age and education for each participant. Scores range from 0 to 100. Higher numbers indicate better cognition. Testing will be performed while participants are supine and standing.
measure.population: 13 participants dropped out (by their choice) prior to study visit. Mean and standard deviation scores for each arm are reported.

outcome.title: Attention Score Using Cogstate Identification Task
outcome.description: Scores are measured as speed to complete task with lower numbers indicating faster reaction time. Testing will be performed while participants are supine and standing.
outcome.population: 13 participants dropped out (by their choice) prior to study visit. Mean and standard deviation scores for each arm are reported.

group.title: POTS- Supine, Standing
group.description: Participants previously diagnosed with postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome who were able to stand unassisted. Odd numbered participants were assigned to cognitive testing in the supine posture first, then in the standing posture.

group.title: POTS- Standing, Supine
group.description: Participants previously diagnosed with postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome who were able to stand unassisted. Even numbered participants were assigned to cognitive testing in the standing posture first, then in the supine posture.

group.title: Control- Supine, Standing
group.description: Healthy volunteers that were free of chronic illness. Odd numbered participants were assigned to cognitive testing in the supine posture first, then in the standing posture.

group.title: Control- Standing, Supine
group.description: Healthy volunteers, free of chronic illness. Even numbered participants were assigned to cognitive testing in the standing posture first, then in the supine posture.

measure.title: Attention Score Using Cogstate Identification Task
measure.description: Scores are measured as speed to complete task with lower numbers indicating faster reaction time. Testing will be performed while participants are supine and standing.
measure.population: 13 participants dropped out (by their choice) prior to study visit. Mean and standard deviation scores for each arm are reported.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Hypermobile Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (hEDS)
outcome.description: hEDS was evaluated using the Diagnostic Criteria for hEDS checklist. The number of participants who fulfill the diagnostic criteria on the checklist are reported.
outcome.population: The number of participants who had hEDS are reported. This assessment was performed without respect to position (standing/supine) and only in POTS participants. Nine POTS participants did not complete this portion of the study. Healthy controls were not included in this outcome measure.

group.title: POTS
group.description: POTS participants completed a screening for hypermobile EDS

measure.title: Number of Participants With Hypermobile Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (hEDS)
measure.description: hEDS was evaluated using the Diagnostic Criteria for hEDS checklist. The number of participants who fulfill the diagnostic criteria on the checklist are reported.
measure.population: The number of participants who had hEDS are reported. This assessment was performed without respect to position (standing/supine) and only in POTS participants. Nine POTS participants did not complete this portion of the study. Healthy controls were not included in this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Heart Rate Standing Minus Heart Rate Supine
outcome.description: Heart rate (HR) will be measured using an arm blood pressure cuff while participants are in supine and standing postures. The difference in heart rate (HR standing - HR supine) was calculated for each participant.
outcome.population: The change in heart rate (HR standing - HR supine) was calculated for each participant. Mean and standard deviation changes in heart rate (standing HR - supine HR) are reported for each study arm.

group.title: POTS
group.description: Participants previously diagnosed with postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome who were able to stand unassisted.

group.title: Control-
group.description: Healthy volunteers that were free of chronic illness.

measure.title: Heart Rate Standing Minus Heart Rate Supine
measure.description: Heart rate (HR) will be measured using an arm blood pressure cuff while participants are in supine and standing postures. The difference in heart rate (HR standing - HR supine) was calculated for each participant.
measure.population: The change in heart rate (HR standing - HR supine) was calculated for each participant. Mean and standard deviation changes in heart rate (standing HR - supine HR) are reported for each study arm.

reported_events.time_frame: During Study Visit, up to 1 hour
reported_events.desc: Participants were not followed after study visit for adverse events.

group.description: Participants previously diagnosed with postural tachycardia syndrome age 13-60 years. Participants completed supine testing first, then standing.

group.description: Healthy volunteers with no chronic/systemic illness age 13-60 years. Participants completed supine testing first, then standing.

group.description: Participants previously diagnosed with postural tachycardia syndrome age 13-60 years. Participants completed standing testing first, then supine.

group.description: Healthy volunteers with no chronic/systemic illness age 13-60 years.Participants completed standing testing first, then supine.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
